Dead by Daylight. Where to start? Its a survival horror game were you either play as a survivor doing certain tasks to escape or a serial killer trying to kill those survivors, sounds boring right? THAT my kind sir or madam or gender neutral pronoun is were you are wrong although I bought this game several years because of my friends convincing me I actually had a really fun experience from the gameplay mechanics that other games are trying to copy to the fact that you could play as your favourite horror movie villain or protagonist. I personally am not a fan or horror but the suspense of knowing that you are playing against real people really does keep you on the edge of your seat, this factor is what makes it challenging but not the way that other games make it where the enemies and everything has insane health except for you. This game I find is actually playable for casual players since although its challenging its not to difficult because you have to work in a team. This game actually uses the team work mechanic really well as unless you cooperate its fun.  I have alot to say about this game but since i dont want people reading an entire essay. I'm going to say this its a really fun game I have no negative opinions on it apart from having to pay for new characters so 8.5/10 Highly recommend

This is the game of PRO's

I cannot recommend this game. While the average gameplay loop can be entertaining, it is frustrating as a new player, and watching higher level play it seems like the issues don't go away.

Firstly, this game has one *hell* of a grind. You have to individually level each killer and survivor to unlock perks to use in each match, with there being no max level and the option to "prestige" if you reach level 50 (max prestige 3). Getting a single killer or survivor to 50 requires millions of the base game currency, bloodpoints. Further, the game wants you to level multiple killers and survivors because every character comes with 3 perks that are "teachable". In other words, each character has 3 perks unique to them, and getting those characters leveled up high enough unlocks those unique perks and allows you to get them on other characters. Thus, to get the "good" or "meta" perks, you have to level several different characters, which will take millions of bloodpoints. In the average game, you will probably get 20k to 30k bloodpoints (some perks and items increase it, but some of the perks that do so are not good, and items are one use only, which means you effectively spend BP to gain BP). Also, all perks have 3 levels, and you have to unlock each perk to get its level, and on average, each level will net you 1, 2, or 3 perks. This is the worst grind I have seen for a game in a really long time, and I used to play Warframe. It's just not worth it.

Secondly, DbD has a massive cheater epidemic. Rare is the day where a DbD streamer does not encounter a cheater, and that should be telling. As popular as a streamer can be, they are one person, and if one person can regularly encounter cheaters then the average person can too. With regards to this, it seems that this has been a common problem for a long time, and BHVR have done nothing about it. Thus, even playing the game has a high chance of wasting your time as you might do nothing but encounter unwinnable games, and with BP tied to performance, those unwinnable games exponentially increase the amount of grinding you have to do to unlock things.

Thirdly, the general way that BHVR seems to be treating its community is not positive. If you mention cheating, or try to bring up and discuss the problem, on the official forums or anything official, you get banned. Nothing anyone does, including their *most popular content creators*, seems to be heard by the devs. Even excluding the cheating problem, I see many people in the community and several content creators give feedback on problems, and it seems like they mostly fall on deaf ears with the exception of the most broken things.

Supposedly, DbD is much better now than it used to be, so it's possible that things could get better. However, I would *highly* recommend keeping a hard distance from this game. Between the rampant cheating problem, the god-awful grind, and in some cases, the very imbalanced systems as a whole (very few perks are actually used, despite there being over a hundred, not to mention the existence of items like moris that greatly imbalance the game), this game just isn't worth your time. You'll start out enjoying the gameplay, but shortly realize the absolute mountain of BS you'll have to deal with just to get on the same playing field as other legit players. Then you realize that every other game has a hacker, and all hope is lost.
oK. So not SUPER cringe, but the community could be better.
